summary: This document is a detailed timeline of events surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It chronicles his activities on August 9, 2019, the discovery of his body on August 10, the immediate response, notifications to authorities, and subsequent investigations by the FBI and OIG over the following days.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death is the central subject of the timeline. He was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced dead.

persons.name: J. Darden
persons.context: A Captain who arrived at the institution on the morning of August 10, 2019, following the incident.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge overseeing Epstein's case, who was notified of his death on August 10, 2019, and later provided with a press release.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: Epstein departs for court in the morning, spends the day in attorney conferences, returns to the SHU in the evening, and is reported to be in good spirits during a social call.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: A body alarm is activated in the SHU at 6:33 am. Staff find Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR is initiated, EMS is called, and he is transported to Beekman Hospital.

events.title: Epstein Pronounced Dead
events.description: The ER physician reports the official time of death at 7:36 am. The FBI, AUSA, and Judge Berman are notified. The body is released to the Medical Examiner for autopsy.

events.title: Investigation and Evidence Collection Begins
events.description: The FBI and OIG are notified and arrive at the MCC. Computer hard drives are removed from the SHU and replaced overnight by the Computer Services Manager.

events.title: Continued FBI and OIG Investigation
events.description: FBI and OIG agents continue working at the institution, including in the communication room. They eventually depart with computer software and systems as evidence.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC New York SHU at approximately 6:33 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
He was pronounced dead by an ER physician at Beekman Hospital at 7:36 am on the same day.
On the evening of August 10, computer hard drives were removed from the SHU and replaced with new ones, indicating immediate evidence preservation.
The FBI and the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) were heavily involved in the investigation at the prison in the days following Epstein's death.
The timeline shows Epstein was in 'good spirits' during a social call at 7:00 pm on August 9, the night before he was found dead.
